intro: Deppea erythrorhiza, commonly known as the red-rooted deppea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and distinctive red roots, which give it its common name. It typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forests and stream banks. Deppea erythrorhiza produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in the spring and early summer.
